definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)

sentences.english: Clothing saturated with oxygen is readily ignitable and will burn vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 吸饱了氧的衣物很容易点燃，而且燃烧剧烈。

sentences.english: So I can totally understand why her students usually call her"Connie Mum".
sentences.chinese: 康妮教授正是这样一位可以点燃学生心灵的好老师。

sentences.english: The spark that ignited their partnership was provided by Mr. Wozniak’s mother.
sentences.chinese: 点燃两人合作之火的火花来自沃兹尼克的母亲。

sentences.english: These luxury candles are too good to burn. D. L. & Co.
sentences.chinese: 这些奢侈至极的蜡烛实在不忍将其点燃。

sentences.english: A soldier took a torch and ignited one of the tents.
sentences.chinese: 一个士兵拿火把点燃了一座帐篷。

sentences.english: The man struck a match and lit his cigar.
sentences.chinese: 那人划了根火柴点燃雪茄。

sentences.english: About the plane from the ground, the McCarran ignited the gasoline floating down the runway.
sentences.chinese: 在飞机即将离地时，麦卡伦点燃了跑道上洒落的汽油。

sentences.english: This means it is self-igniting in air.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着它在空气中自己点燃。

sentences.english: An Afghan worker cuts firewood to light a brick kiln in Kabul.
sentences.chinese: 在喀布尔，一阿富汗工人削木柴，以点燃砖窑。

sentences.english: In the distance, a woman grasped a handful of green incense and carefully lit it.
sentences.chinese: 在远处，一个女人抓住了一把绿香小心把它点燃。

sentences.english: Re- ignited the torch of life.
He fumbled his one-handed attempt to light his cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他笨拙地想用一只手点燃香烟。

sentences.english: A patent-pending hinge secures your Kindle to the cover.
sentences.chinese: 正在申请专利的铰链作保你点燃的封面。

sentences.english: Passion sparks dream, Sport opens a new chapter of communication.
sentences.chinese: 激情点燃梦想火焰，运动抒写东师华章。

sentences.english: A thriving black market helps fuel the Apple mania.
sentences.chinese: 繁荣的黑市帮助点燃了对苹果产品的狂热。

sentences.english: He pulled off his gloves, took out his matches, and lighted the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他脱下了自己的手套，掏出了火柴，点燃了火苗。

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
